poem:
Education's Burden

A classroom, cold  
with the weight of futures—  
papers and pencils  
scratching the surface  
of young minds.  
  
Politicians perplex  
the clay of innocence,  
molding it stern  
without care for  
the gentle bloom.  
  
In halls echo  
questions unanswered,  
while small hearts  
bear the heavy  
burden of learning.
